author: Robert Hughes

quote: I think having land and not ruining it is the most beautiful art that anybody could ever want to own.
author: Andy Warhol

quote: Hip-hop culture is probably one of the most powerful things to come out of America in a long time - everything from the music to the art to the dance to the language.
author: will.i.am

quote: All art is exorcism. I paint dreams and visions too; the dreams and visions of my time. Painting is the effort to produce order; order in yourself. There is much chaos in me, much chaos in our time.
author: Otto Dix

quote: Please bear in mind that my observations and thoughts are the outcome of my own unaided impulse and curiosity alone; for, besides myself, in our town there be no philosophers who practice this art, so pray, take not amiss my poor pen and the liberty I here take in setting down my random notions.
author: Antonie van Leeuwenhoek

quote: Diplomacy, n. is the art of letting somebody else have your way.
author: David Frost

quote: Art used to be made in the name of faith. We made cathedrals, we made stained-glass windows, we made murals.
author: Julia Cameron

quote: Ah, the creative process is the same secret in science as it is in art. They are all the same absolutely.
author: Josef Albers

quote: What I wanted to do was to paint sunlight on the side of a house.
author: Edward Hopper

quote: The principle of art is to pause, not bypass.
author: Jerzy Kosinski

quote: When you create art, the world has to wait.
author: Will Smith

quote: The essence of all art is to have pleasure in giving pleasure.
author: Dale Carnegie

quote: The state of female artists is very good. But the very definition of art has been biased in that 'art' was what men did in a European tradition and 'crafts' were what women and natives did. But it's actually all the same.
author: Gloria Steinem

quote: The sculptor produces the beautiful statue by chipping away such parts of the marble block as are not needed - it is a process of elimination.
author: Elbert Hubbard

quote: Irresponsibility is part of the pleasure of all art; it is the part the schools cannot recognize.
author: James Joyce

quote: Shadows sometimes people don't see shadows. The Chinese of course never paint them in pictures, oriental art never deals with shadow. But I noticed these shadows and I knew it meant it was sunny.
author: David Hockney

quote: The surrealists, and the modern movement in painting as a whole, seemed to offer a key to the strange postwar world with its threat of nuclear war. The dislocations and ambiguities, in cubism and abstract art as well as the surrealists, reminded me of my childhood in Shanghai.
author: J. G. Ballard

quote: Art is accusation, expression, passion. Art is a fight to the finish between black charcoal and white paper.
author: Gunter Grass

quote: Everything great in science and art is simple. What can be less complicated than the greatest discoveries of humanity - gravitation, the compass, the printing press, the steam engine, the electric telegraph?
author: Jules Verne

quote: The main thing in making art often is letting go of your expectation and your idea.
author: Agnes Martin

quote: Impressionism; it is the birth of Light in painting.
author: Robert Delaunay

quote: Every other artist begins with a blank canvas, a piece of paper the photographer begins with the finished product.
author: Edward Steichen

quote: I never called my work an 'art'. It's part of show business, the business of building entertainment.
author: Walt Disney

quote: If art is to nourish the roots of our culture, society must set the artist free to follow his vision wherever it takes him.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: I have trouble with modern art. But in general, all art forms fascinate me - art is the way human beings express what we can't say in words.
author: Andrea Bocelli

quote: I'm interested in what would normally be considered the worst aspects of commercial art. I think it's the tension between what seems to be so rigid and cliched and the fact that art really can't be this way.
author: Roy Lichtenstein

quote: My love of fine art increased - the more of it I saw, the more of it I wanted to see.
author: J. Paul Getty

quote: If my art has nothing to do with people's pain and sorrow, what is 'art' for?
author: Ai Weiwei

quote: Architecture is the art of how to waste space.
author: Philip Johnson

quote: My own interest in art was because of my mother. My father didn't like contemporary art, so he didn't give her large sums to spend. So, she began buying prints and drawings. During my school days, I remember sitting in on many of the early meetings.
author: David Rockefeller

quote: Art requires philosophy, just as philosophy requires art. Otherwise, what would become of beauty?
author: Paul Gauguin

quote: Our best teachers do more than impart facts and figures - they inspire and encourage students and instill a true desire to learn. That's a fine art in itself.
author: Sonny Perdue

quote: I'm always trying to find 'connections' between things. That art is the juxtaposition of a lot of things that seem unrelated but add up to something recognizable.
author: Pat Metheny

quote: I always imagined myself somehow as an electron around some atom, and you're just, like, bouncing around and spinning. There was a never-ending supply of places to go, people to see, things to do, and fitting it all in became kind of an art.
author: Tom Freston

quote: The creative act lasts but a brief moment, a lightning instant of give-and-take, just long enough for you to level the camera and to trap the fleeting prey in your little box.
author: Henri Cartier-Bresson

quote: The Internet is both great and terrible. As a source of information, a tool for delivering music and art, it's great. But spamming ads and piracy of music is terrible. It's stealing.
author: Gary Wright

quote: As far as playing jazz, no other art form, other than conversation, can give the satisfaction of spontaneous interaction.
author: Stan Getz

quote: All art is but imitation of nature.
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: Treat a work of art like a prince. Let it speak to you first.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: Real art is basic emotion. If a scene is handled with simplicity - and I don't mean simple - it'll be good, and the public will know it.
author: John Wayne

quote: The very essence of the creative is its novelty, and hence we have no standard by which to judge it.
author: Carl Rogers

quote: To be an artist includes much; one must possess many gifts - absolute gifts - which have not been acquired by one's own effort. And, moreover, to succeed, the artist much possess the courageous soul.
author: Kate Chopin

quote: I find pop art really offensive because it's taking a piece of popular culture and putting it somewhere where people can't see it.
author: Rebecca Sugar

quote: In Japan, I am famous in certain special circles - mainly as someone who is trying to break down and enlighten the conventions of Japanese art.
author: Takashi Murakami

quote: Art to me is an anecdote of the spirit, and the only means of making concrete the purpose of its varied quickness and stillness.
author: Mark Rothko

quote: Science and art, or by the same token, poetry and prose differ from one another like a journey and an excursion. The purpose of the journey is its goal, the purpose of an excursion is the process.
author: Franz Grillparzer

quote: Great artists are people who find the way to be themselves in their art. Any sort of pretension induces mediocrity in art and life alike.
author: Margot Fonteyn

quote: Lying in bed would be an altogether perfect and supreme experience if only one had a colored pencil long enough to draw on the ceiling.
author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

quote: Art is not for the cultivated taste. It is to cultivate taste.
author: Nikki Giovanni

quote: Modernity is the transitory, the fugitive, the contingent, which make up one half of art, the other being the eternal and the immutable. This transitory fugitive element, which is constantly changing, must not be despised or neglected.
author: Charles Baudelaire

quote: A painter, who finds no satisfaction in mere representation, however artistic, in his longing to express his inner life, cannot but envy the ease with which music, the most non-material of the arts today, achieves this end. He naturally seeks to apply the methods of music to his own art.
author: Wassily Kandinsky

quote: If a patron buys from an artist who needs money, the patron then makes himself equal to the artist; he is building art into the world; he creates.
author: Ezra Pound

quote: We are so fortunate, as Australians, to have among us the oldest continuing cultures in human history. Cultures that link our nation with deepest antiquity. We have Aboriginal rock art in the Kimberley that is as ancient as the great Palaeolithic cave paintings at Altamira and Lascaux in Europe.
author: Kevin Rudd

quote: I believe in myself and my art so much. I've always trusted destiny. Wherever it takes me, I just work damn hard at the opportunity.
author: Priyanka Chopra

quote: I think that a society lives or dies according to its respect for - for its art.
author: Kris Kristofferson

quote: One's art goes as far and as deep as one's love goes.
author: Andrew Wyeth

quote: Modesty: the gentle art of enhancing your charm by pretending not to be aware of it.
author: Oliver Herford

quote: Once you learn to look at architecture not merely as an art more or less well or more or less badly done, but as a social manifestation, the critical eye becomes clairvoyant.
author: Louis Sullivan

quote: I rarely draw what I see. I draw what I feel in my body.
author: Barbara Hepworth

quote: The reason I do this job is because I started to be a painter. Making money in art was difficult. The easiest way to make money was to use art for some other reason. One of the easiest and most interesting from an economic point of view was fashion. Fashion pays.
author: Franco Moschino

quote: Without freedom, no art; art lives only on the restraints it imposes on itself, and dies of all others.
author: Albert Camus

quote: All art really does is keep you focused on questions of humanity, and it really is about how do we get on with our maker.
author: David Bowie

quote: Art was, seriously, the only thing I'd ever wanted to own. It has always been for me a stable nourishment. I use it. It can change the way that I feel in the mornings.
author: David Bowie

quote: In Art, man reveals himself and not his objects.
author: Rabindranath Tagore

quote: A writer should write with his eyes and a painter paint with his ears.
author: Gertrude Stein

quote: Very few people possess true artistic ability. It is therefore both unseemly and unproductive to irritate the situation by making an effort. If you have a burning, restless urge to write or paint, simply eat something sweet and the feeling will pass.
author: Fran Lebowitz

quote: Rules and models destroy genius and art.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: Discipline in art is a fundamental struggle to understand oneself, as much as to understand what one is drawing.
author: Henry Moore

quote: A work of art doesn't exist outside the perception of the audience.
author: Abbas Kiarostami

quote: Art is the most beautiful of all lies.
author: Claude Debussy

quote: Too often, complaint is not about principled objection on moral grounds, but opportunistic objection on grounds of self-interest. To rectify this, we need to work on mastering the art of complaint.
author: Julian Baggini

quote: Food can be expressive and therefore food can be art.
author: Grant Achatz

quote: My mom is a painter and an artist. She would play music, and she always had very good taste in music, fashion, and art. She was also a young single mom, so I think she had really good style; she was really free... just really inspiring in her own way and allowed me to find the direction I wanted to take in my life.
author: Ruby Rose

quote: Art is where we make a stand. If we don't make it there, freedom of expression is lost for everyone - for artists, for journalists, and for everyday people.
author: Lucien Bourjeily

quote: In a storm, I think, 'What if the gospel be not true? Then thou art, of all men, most foolish. For what has thou given up thy goods, thy ease, thy friends, thy reputation, thy country, thy life?'
author: John Wesley

quote: An artist never really finishes his work, he merely abandons it.
author: Paul Valery

quote: Winners have the ability to step back from the canvas of their lives like an artist gaining perspective. They make their lives a work of art - an individual masterpiece.
author: Denis Waitley

quote: Even Michelangelo got paid for doing the Sistine Chapel. To those artists who say they're doing it for the love of art, I say: Get real.
author: Gianni Versace

quote: Art hurts. Art urges voyages - and it is easier to stay at home.
author: Gwendolyn Brooks

quote: Art produces ugly things which frequently become more beautiful with time. Fashion, on the other hand, produces beautiful things which always become ugly with time.
author: Jean Cocteau

quote: Film should be looked at straight on; it is not the art of scholars but of illiterates.
author: Werner Herzog

quote: Originality is the fine art of remembering what you hear but forgetting where you heard it.
author: Laurence J. Peter

quote: The worst state of affairs is when science begins to concern itself with art.
author: Paul Klee

quote: Art is pattern informed by sensibility.
author: Herbert Read

quote: And luckily, therefore the good old days return. The traditional art of driving counts again, and it is all about good tactics, skills and reflexes instead of simple power.
author: Jacky Ickx

quote: Pictures must not be too picturesque.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: The highest art is always the most religious, and the greatest artist is always a devout person.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: Ads are the cave art of the twentieth century.
author: Marshall McLuhan

quote: Works of art, in my opinion, are the only objects in the material universe to possess internal order, and that is why, though I don't believe that only art matters, I do believe in Art for Art's sake.
author: E. M. Forster

quote: Religion and art spring from the same root and are close kin. Economics and art are strangers.
author: Nathaniel Hawthorne

quote: Models are there to look like mannequins, not like real people. Art and illusion are supposed to be fantasy.
author: Grace Jones

quote: Art is the concrete representation of our most subtle feelings.
author: Agnes Martin

quote: Summer is a great time to visit art museums, which offer the refreshing rinse of swimming pools - only instead of cool water, you immerse yourself in art.
author: Jerry Saltz

quote: Capitalism and power politics have made our generation creatively sluggish, and our vital art is mired in a broad bourgeois philistinism.
author: Walter Gropius

quote: Art is an expression of who we are, what we believe, and what we dream about.
author: Julianne Moore

quote: My motivation for being a good drummer was born out of fear, which, in a way, seems so antithetical to what art should be.
author: Damien Chazelle

quote: Murals in restaurants are on a par with the food in museums.
author: Peter De Vries

quote: I choose a block of marble and chop off whatever I don't need.
author: Auguste Rodin

quote: Art is subject to arbitrary fashion.
author: Kary Mullis

quote: A good face they say, is a letter of recommendation. O Nature, Nature, why art thou so dishonest, as ever to send men with these false recommendations into the World!
author: Henry Fielding

quote: When that shutter clicks, anything else that can be done afterward is not worth consideration.
author: Edward Steichen

quote: Commerce and art are natural enemies. And also, the enemy of good is great. And the enemy of great is good, so there's this huge juggling that's going on all the time.
author: David Foster

quote: A work of art that contains theories is like an object on which the price tag has been left.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: There is hardly any money interest in art, and music will be there when money is gone.
author: Duke Ellington

quote: A secondhand wardrobe hand clothes doesn't make one an artist. Neither do a hair-trigger temper, melancholic nature, propensity for tears, hating your parents, or HIV. I hate to say it - none of these make one an artist. They can help, but just as being gay doesn't make one witty... the only thing that makes one an artist is making art.
author: David Rakoff

quote: Art is the unceasing effort to compete with the beauty of flowers - and never succeeding.
author: Gian Carlo Menotti

quote: Once an object has been incorporated in a picture it accepts a new destiny.
author: Georges Braque

quote: I thought art was dead rabbits hanging by their feet on a wall. I went to Italy and saw all the religious paintings, and they didn't move me all that much. Then someone invited me to see this van Gogh exhibit at the Rosenberg Gallery in San Francisco.
author: Irving Stone

quote: Art is a step from what is obvious and well-known toward what is arcane and concealed.
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: Fashion is only the attempt to realize art in living forms and social intercourse.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: Art is man's expression of his joy in labor.
author: Henry Kissinger

quote: An artist cannot speak about his art any more than a plant can discuss horticulture.
author: Jean Cocteau

quote: I think art cannot be planned. The audience is too smart to get the dishonesty or 'too much planning' thing. I am not a legend, but I want to be one. I want to be known as an achiever. There is so much more that I can do.
author: Priyanka Chopra

quote: It is art that makes life, makes interest, makes importance and I know of no substitute whatever for the force and beauty of its process.
author: Max Eastman

quote: The goal of art was the vital expression of self.
author: Alfred Stieglitz

quote: Artists who seek perfection in everything are those who cannot attain it in anything.
author: Gustave Flaubert

quote: An original artist is unable to copy. So he has only to copy in order to be original.
author: Jean Cocteau

quote: Art is the triumph over chaos.
author: John Cheever

quote: It may be that the deep necessity of art is the examination of self-deception.
author: Robert Motherwell

quote: One eye sees, the other feels.
author: Paul Klee

quote: Great art is as irrational as great music. It is mad with its own loveliness.
author: George Jean Nathan

quote: There is no prejudice that the work of art does not finally overcome.
author: Andre Gide

quote: If you know somethin' well, you can always paint it but people would be better off buyin' chickens.
author: Grandma Moses

quote: No great artist ever sees things as they really are. If he did, he would cease to be an artist.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: A great city, whose image dwells in the memory of man, is the type of some great idea. Rome represents conquest; Faith hovers over the towers of Jerusalem; and Athens embodies the pre-eminent quality of the antique world, Art.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: I feel like skateboarding is as much of a sport as a lifestyle, and an art form, so there's so much that that transcends in terms of music, fashion, and entertainment.
author: Tony Hawk

quote: Art is science made clear.
author: Wilson Mizner

quote: If I didn't choose art, I would have become an astronomer.
author: Peter Max

quote: The artist must create a spark before he can make a fire and before art is born, the artist must be ready to be consumed by the fire of his own creation.
author: Auguste Rodin

quote: I've read that the ancient Chinese art of feng shui can bring a sense of peace, well-being, and positive energy to a home - same as beer.
author: W. Bruce Cameron

quote: Every artist was first an amateur.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: I'm free. I just do what I want, say what I want, say how I feel, and I don't try to hurt nobody. I just try to make sure that I don't compromise my art in any kind of way, and I think people respect that.
author: Erykah Badu

quote: Divine Nature gave the fields, human art built the cities.
author: Marcus Terentius Varro

quote: Art has to move you and design does not, unless it's a good design for a bus.
author: David Hockney

quote: I'm inspired by artists and musicians. There are so many wonderful and talented people in the world. I love discovering new music, new writers, or new art.
author: Alicia Keys

quote: I started as a black and white photographer, but the colors I was seeing were just so lurid and compelling and awful at the same time. They got me looking at other contemporary art. I was gravitating more and more toward work that had visceral power, that wasn't necessarily about being beautiful but had some kind of horror in the palette.
author: David Maisel

quote: Rhetoric may be defined as the faculty of observing in any given case the available means of persuasion. This is not a function of any other art.
author: Aristotle

quote: Only through art can we emerge from ourselves and know what another person sees.
author: Marcel Proust

quote: O, you men who think or say that I am malevolent, stubborn or misanthropic, how greatly do you wrong me. You do not know the secret cause which makes me seem that way to you, and I would have ended my life - it was only my art that held me back. Ah, it seemed impossible to leave the world until I had brought forth all that I felt was within me.
author: Ludwig van Beethoven

quote: Cyberbullying isn't real. But bullying and harassment certainly are real. Trust me, friends, I went to school in England. They've got bullying down to a fine art. I know, because I was one of its chief architects. I was awful to my fellow schoolboys.
author: Milo Yiannopoulos

quote: The art of leadership is saying no, not saying yes. It is very easy to say yes.
author: Tony Blair

quote: Many great works of art, poetry, and music are inspired by astral memories. The desire to do noble, beautiful things here on Earth is also often a carryover of astral experiences between a person's earth lives.
author: Paramahansa Yogananda

quote: Painting is the most magical of mediums. The transcendence is truly amazing to me every time I go to a museum and I see how somebody figured another way to rub colored dirt on a flat surface and make space where there is no space or make you think of a life experience.
author: Chuck Close

quote: Why must art be static? You look at an abstraction, sculptured or painted, an entirely exciting arrangement of planes, spheres, nuclei, entirely without meaning. It would be perfect, but it is always still. The next step in sculpture is motion.
author: Alexander Calder

quote: Art is dangerous. It is one of the attractions: when it ceases to be dangerous you don't want it.
author: Duke Ellington

quote: We work in the dark - we do what we can - we give what we have. Our doubt is our passion and our passion is our task. The rest is the madness of art.
author: Henry James

quote: I try to keep a low profile in general. Not with my art, but just as a person.
author: Alanis Morissette

quote: All of Koons's best art - the encased vacuum cleaners, the stainless-steel Rabbit (the late-twentieth century's signature work of Simulationist sculpture), the amazing gleaming Balloon Dog, and the cast-iron re-creation of a Civil War mortar exhibited last month at the Armory - has simultaneously flaunted extreme realism, idealism, and fantasy.
author: Jerry Saltz

quote: Art to me is a humanitarian act and I believe that there is a responsibility that art should somehow be able to effect mankind, to make the word a better place.
author: Jeff Koons

quote: During the Middle Ages they understood that words accompanied by imagery are much more memorable. By making the margins of a book colorful and beautiful, illuminations help make the text unforgettable. It's unfortunate that we've lost the art of illumination.
author: Joshua Foer

quote: Only in art will the lion lie down with the lamb, and the rose grow without the thorn.
author: Martin Amis

quote: I paint; I draw and paint - I've been doing that since I was in third grade, drawing realistically and then changing to abstract art. That was my first creative thing before guitar or comedy.
author: Steven Wright

quote: I don't think art is propaganda; it should be something that liberates the soul, provokes the imagination and encourages people to go further. It celebrates humanity instead of manipulating it.
author: Keith Haring

quote: Enjoying art is a personal matter. It's made up by contemplation, silence, abstraction.
author: Renzo Piano

quote: Oratory is the masterful art. Poetry, painting, music, sculpture, architecture please, thrill, inspire - but oratory rules. The orator dominates those who hear him, convinces their reason, controls their judgment, compels their action. For the time being, he is master.
author: David Josiah Brewer

quote: In the practical art of war, the best thing of all is to take the enemy's country whole and intact; to shatter and destroy it is not so good.
author: Sun Tzu

quote: When hospitality becomes an art it loses its very soul.
author: Max Beerbohm

quote: When you walk down the street and see something in a crazy spot, there's something powerful about that. The street will always be an important part of getting art out there for me.
author: Shepard Fairey

quote: What is the intersection between technology, art and science? Curiosity and wonder, because it drives us to explore, because we're surrounded by things we can't see.
author: Louie Schwartzberg

quote: Graffiti's always been a temporary art form. You make your mark and then they scrub it off.
author: Banksy

quote: Should graffiti be judged on the same level as modern art? Of course not: It's way more important than that.
author: Banksy

quote: It is after all the greatest art to limit and isolate oneself.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: To array a man's will against his sickness is the supreme art of medicine.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: The artist produces for the liberation of his soul. It is his nature to create as it is the nature of water to run down the hill.
author: W. Somerset Maugham

quote: It's not new that architecture can profoundly affect a place, sometimes transform it. Architecture and any art can transform a person, even save someone.
author: Frank Gehry

quote: The Chinese art world does not exist. In a society that restricts individual freedoms and violates human rights, anything that calls itself creative or independent is a pretence. It is impossible for a totalitarian society to create anything with passion and imagination.
author: Ai Weiwei

quote: If only life could be a little more tender and art a little more robust.
author: Alan Rickman

quote: I always saw candy as art.
author: Dylan Lauren

quote: When I think of art I think of beauty. Beauty is the mystery of life. It is not in the eye it is in the mind. In our minds there is awareness of perfection.
author: Agnes Martin

quote: Women's art, political art - those categorisations perpetuate a certain kind of marginality which I'm resistant to. But I absolutely define myself as a feminist.
author: Barbara Kruger

quote: No matter what is happening in life or in the world - war, natural disaster, poor health, pain, the death of loved ones - if existence is filled with art, music and literature, life will be fulfilling, a joy.
author: Karen DeCrow

quote: Nude nail polish wins hands down over intricate nail art.
author: Ashley Madekwe

quote: All art is propaganda, and ever must be, despite the wailing of the purists. I stand in utter shamelessness and say that whatever art I have for writing has been used always for propaganda for gaining the right of black folk to love and enjoy. I do not care a damn for any art that is not used for propaganda.
author: W. E. B. Du Bois

quote: Life is short, the art long.
author: Hippocrates

quote: And the first rude sketch that the world had seen was joy to his mighty heart, till the Devil whispered behind the leaves 'It's pretty, but is it Art?'
author: Rudyard Kipling

quote: I think that the destructive element is too much neglected in art.
author: Piet Mondrian

quote: Every work of art is the child of its age and, in many cases, the mother of our emotions. It follows that each period of culture produces an art of its own which can never be repeated.
author: Wassily Kandinsky

quote: There is no must in art because art is free.
author: Wassily Kandinsky

quote: I like to pretend that my art has nothing to do with me.
author: Roy Lichtenstein

quote: One must do the same subject over again ten times, a hundred times. In art nothing must resemble an accident, not even movement.
author: Edgar Degas

quote: Is the Mona Lisa an 'accurate' representation of the actual human model for the painting? Who knows? Who cares? It's a great piece of art. It moves us. It makes us wonder, makes us gape - finally makes us look inward at ourselves.
author: Tim O'Brien

quote: I enjoy going out by myself... always have, always will. I don't have security guards, and, for the most part, I enjoy meeting new people. I see myself as a regular guy who likes playing video games with his nieces and nephews and poker with his family. I don't have an art collection or take exotic vacations. I enjoy being at home.
author: Vince Vaughn

quote: I don't like to say I have given my life to art. I prefer to say art has given me my life.
author: Frank Stella

quote: I am enough of an artist to draw freely upon my imagination.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: The enemy of art is the absence of limitations.
author: Orson Welles

quote: Controversy is part of the nature of art and creativity.
author: Yoko Ono

quote: It's obviously funny to be a meme, so I could be down with it in that regard, but it also belittles one's art.
author: Grimes

quote: Life beats down and crushes the soul and art reminds you that you have one.
author: Stella Adler

quote: Great art picks up where nature ends.
author: Marc Chagall

quote: Fashion, for me, is anything that's aesthetic and beautiful. Art, food, film. It's something that I appreciate and really like.
author: St. Vincent

quote: Art is contemplation. It is the pleasure of the mind which searches into nature and which there divines the spirit of which nature herself is animated.
author: Auguste Rodin

quote: Balance is key. Balance is a virtue. Balance is next to godliness, maybe. We should all aspire to better balance. Too much of what is said in this world is one-sided, and we need more balance - in our speech, in our music, in our art, in everything.
author: CeeLo Green

quote: Filmmaking is a huge privilege; it's not brain surgery. It's art, and art is supposed to be an enjoyable process, and it is an enjoyable experience for me.
author: Lake Bell

quote: The artist who aims at perfection in everything achieves it in nothing.
author: Eugene Delacroix

quote: The business of art is to reveal the relation between man and his environment.
author: D. H. Lawrence

quote: Boxing's in my genes. I come from a fighting background. My dad and both my uncles were good boxers. I'm blessed with the art of war.
author: Floyd Mayweather, Jr.

quote: Every good painter paints what he is.
author: Jackson Pollock

quote: At the end of the day, I just do my job. I love my art. But I genuinely want to change the world. I'm very generous, and I really want people to see that I am - that's really it.
author: Millie Bobby Brown

quote: Melodrama is one of the most stunning art forms. These are stories where the emotions are big, and the situations are big, and the artists believe in the situation dramatically. There's no irony or distance.
author: James Gray

quote: Filmmaking is a completely imperfect art form that takes years and, over those years, the movie tells you what it is. Mistakes happen, accidents happen and true great films are the results of those mistakes and the decisions that those directors make during those moments.
author: Jason Reitman

quote: I experimented with fashion as it being more like art, allowing what I wore to express what I was feeling on the inside. Androgyny, rock culture, and grunge - they definitely had an effect on the things that made me feel cool and comfortable.
author: Ruby Rose

quote: Every article on these islands has an almost personal character, which gives this simple life, where all art is unknown, something of the artistic beauty of medieval life.
author: John Millington Synge

quote: Wisdom is nothing but a preparation of the soul, a capacity, a secret art of thinking, feeling and breathing thoughts of unity at every moment of life.
author: Herman Hesse

quote: I just want to make art that connects with people and moves them on an emotional level. Any time I can put out music and place a story behind it and have people watch it and go, 'Wow, I was affected by that,' to me, feels like I've done my job.
author: Hayley Kiyoko

quote: Obviously, the cinematography of films is art, just as a still shot can be art. If I'm watching a Wes Anderson movie, the colour palettes alone, and the way they're painted, could be art. With music, you're a little bit limited, of course, because it's only audio.
author: Frank Ocean

quote: The strangeness will wear off and I think we will discover the deeper meanings in modern art.
author: Jackson Pollock

quote: The artist's job is to be a witness to his time in history.
author: Robert Rauschenberg

quote: For me, art doesn't stop at the gallery space.
author: Petra Collins

quote: I think most people agree there is a component of skill in art making; you have to learn grammar before you learn how to write.
author: Chris Van Allsburg

quote: Herman Melville was supposed to be an accountant. Van Gogh was meant to be an art dealer. I was meant to take the train into New York and work for a bank. To be an artist, you have to say goodbye to your family.
author: Don McLean

quote: An album is a whole universe, and the recording studio is a three-dimensional kind of art space that I can fill with sound. Just as the album art and videos are ways of adding more dimensions to the words and music. I like to be involved in all of it because it's all of a piece.
author: Bat for Lashes

quote: The strong bond of sisterhood was a famous trait in classical art and literature about Amazons. But it was modern people who interpreted that as a sexual preference for women. That started in the 20th century. The Russian poet Marina Tsvetaeva declared that Amazons were symbolic of lesbianism in antiquity.
author: Adrienne Mayor

quote: Art is a critical component in a well-rounded education. Art is the level playing field - no matter how rich or poor, tall or short, pretty or ugly to the bone, if you can draw, you can find personal fulfillment and build self-confidence. Art is the highest achievement of mankind.
author: Lynda Resnick

quote: Parks are works of art just as a painting or sculpture is.
author: Thomas Hoving

quote: Thirty-three-years-old, still creating art. It's rage, it's creativity, it's pain, it's hurt, but it's the opportunity to still have my voice get out there through music.
author: Kanye West

quote: Dear God! how beauty varies in nature and art. In a woman the flesh must be like marble; in a statue the marble must be like flesh.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: I was going to go to a four-year college and be an anthropologist or to an art school and be an illustrator when a friend convinced me to learn photography at the University of Southern California. Little did I know it was a school that taught you how to make movies! It had never occurred to me that I'd ever have any interest in filmmaking.
author: George Lucas

quote: Smiles come naturally to me, but I started thinking of them as an art form at my command. I studied all the time. I looked at magazines, I'd practice in front of the mirror and I'd ask photographers about the best angles. I can now pull out a smile at will.
author: Tyra Banks

quote: Courtesy is a silver lining around the dark clouds of civilization; it is the best part of refinement and in many ways, an art of heroic beauty in the vast gallery of man's cruelty and baseness.
author: Bryant H. McGill

quote: Art consists of reshaping life, but it does not create life nor cause life.
author: Stanley Kubrick

quote: Architecture is a art when one consciously or unconsciously creates aesthetic emotion in the atmosphere and when this environment produces well being.
author: Luis Barragan

quote: Art is a harmony parallel with nature.
author: Paul Cezanne

quote: The Bauhaus strives to bring together all creative effort into one whole, to reunify all the disciplines of practical art - sculpture, painting, handicrafts, and crafts - as inseparable components of a new architecture.
author: Walter Gropius

quote: The greatness of art is not to find what is common but what is unique.
author: Isaac Bashevis Singer

quote: You cannot say, 'Go! Go! Rah! Rah! Good move!' People want some emotion. Chess is an art and not a spectator sport.
author: Garry Kasparov

quote: Art is nothing if you don't reach every segment of the people.
author: Keith Haring

quote: Thought is a strenuous art - few practice it, and then only at rare times.
author: David Ben-Gurion

quote: My eyes were made to erase all that is ugly.
author: Raoul Dufy

quote: Poetry is the art of substantiating shadows, and of lending existence to nothing.
author: Edmund Burke

quote: I went into the business for the money, and the art grew out of it. If people are disillusioned by that remark, I can't help it. It's the truth.
author: Charlie Chaplin

quote: Without the emotion of the beautiful, the sublime, the mysterious, there is no art, no religion, no literature.
author: John Burroughs

quote: Colloquial poetry is to the real art as the barber's wax dummy is to sculpture.
author: Ezra Pound

quote: Making art, good art, is always a struggle. It can make you happy when you pull it off. There's no better feeling. It's beauteous. But it's always about hard work and inspiration and sweat and good ideas.
author: Damien Hirst

quote: What distinguishes modern art from the art of other ages is criticism.
author: Octavio Paz

quote: Stand-up comedy is an art form and it dies unless you expand it.
author: Sam Kinison

quote: Washington, D.C., has everything that Rome, Paris and London have in the way of great architecture - great power bases. Washington has obelisks and pyramids and underground tunnels and great art and a whole shadow world that we really don't see.
author: Dan Brown

quote: Gossip is the art of saying nothing in a way that leaves practically nothing unsaid.
author: Walter Winchell

quote: Copy, art, and typography should be seen as a living entity; each element integrally related, in harmony with the whole, and essential to the execution of an idea.
author: Paul Rand

quote: Memory is a great artist. For every man and for every woman it makes the recollection of his or her life a work of art and an unfaithful record.
author: Andre Maurois

quote: Our appreciation of folk art will strengthen our identities, our pride in belonging to a community. People trained in the creative use of their hands soon acquire skills, excellent craftsmanship which will be the most important measure of how well we can industrialize.
author: F. Sionil Jose

quote: We were astonished by the beauty and refinement of the art displayed by the objects surpassing all we could have imagined - the impression was overwhelming.
author: Howard Carter

quote: Cats are anthropomorphised in art because they are so laid back that you automatically attribute human thoughts and feelings to them.
author: Jim Davis

quote: I think art teaches us how to feel, what our parameters can be, what sensations can be like; it makes you more engaged with life.
author: Jeff Koons

quote: Consciousness permits us to develop the instruments of culture - morality and justice, religion, art, economics and politics, science and technology. Those instruments allow us some measure of freedom in the confrontation with nature.
author: Antonio Damasio

quote: In every work of art the subject is primordial, whether the artist knows it or not. The measure of the formal qualities is only a sign of the measure of the artist's obsession with his subject; the form is always in proportion to the obsession.
author: Alberto Giacometti

quote: Everybody thinks they know what art should be. But very few of them have the sense that is necessary to experience painting, that is the sense of sight, that sees colors and forms as living reality in the picture.
author: Otto Dix

quote: It is now life and not art that requires the willing suspension of disbelief.
author: Lionel Trilling

quote: An art book is a museum without walls.
author: Andre Malraux

quote: I paint with shapes.
author: Alexander Calder

quote: What does that represent? There was never any question in plastic art, in poetry, in music, of representing anything. It is a matter of making something beautiful, moving, or dramatic - this is by no means the same thing.
author: Fernand Leger

quote: Painting is the passage from the chaos of the emotions to the order of the possible.
author: Balthus

quote: A work of art is the unique result of a unique temperament.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: We all know that Art is not truth. Art is a lie that makes us realize the truth, at least the truth that is given to us to understand.
author: Pablo Picasso

quote: Art is not living. It is the use of living.
author: Audre Lorde

quote: The whole aspect of cinema and film festivals should be a moment to come together and celebrate art and humanity. It would be a shame if there was such a divide.
author: Keanu Reeves

quote: What is comedy? Comedy is the art of making people laugh without making them puke.
author: Steve Martin

quote: Politics is the art of choosing between the disastrous and the unpalatable.
author: John Kenneth Galbraith

quote: Yesterday I was thinking about the whole idea of genius and creative people, and the notion that if you create some magical art, somehow that exempts you from having to pay attention to the small things.
author: bell hooks

quote: Art is born of humiliation.
author: W. H. Auden

quote: The essence of all art is to have pleasure in giving pleasure.
author: Mikhail Baryshnikov

quote: If I can't be fishing or hunting, I want to be in the Museum of Modern Art in New York.
author: Jim Harrison

quote: Art can only be truly art by presenting an adequate outward symbol of some fact in the interior life.
author: Margaret Fuller

quote: There's a snobbery at work in architecture. The subject is too often treated as a fine art, delicately wrapped in mumbo-jumbo. In reality, it's an all-embracing discipline taking in science, art, maths, engineering, climate, nature, politics, economics.
author: Norman Foster

quote: I came up with the term 'mindfreak' because I didn't like the word 'magician.' I felt like I wanted to coin a term that would be basically the reaction to my art. It would be a mindfreak and so that's why I came up with that. But, many people say I'm really a student of humanity and psychology.
author: Criss Angel

quote: Art is the signature of civilizations.
author: Beverly Sills

quote: The practice of medicine is a thinker's art the practice of surgery a plumber's.
author: Martin H. Fischer

quote: In this world, with thy earthly life, thou art under heaven, stars, and elements, also under hell and devils; all ruleth in thee, and over thee.
author: Jakob Bohme

quote: I believe in the city as a natural human environment, but we must humanize it. It's art that will re-define public space in the 21st Century. We can make our cities diverse, inspirational places by putting art, dance and performance in all its forms into the matrix of street life.
author: Antony Gormley

quote: My imagination can picture no fairer happiness than to continue living for art.
author: Clara Schumann

quote: All the world old is queer save thee and me, and even thou art a little queer.
author: Robert Owen

quote: Anybody can direct a picture once they know the fundamentals. Directing is not a mystery, it's not an art. The main thing about directing is: photograph the people's eyes.
author: John Ford

quote: Coming out of the Louvre for the first time in 1971, dizzy with new love, I stood on Pont Neuf and made a pledge to myself that the art of this newly discovered world in the Old World would be my life companion.
author: Susan Vreeland

quote: The artist's world is limitless. It can be found anywhere, far from where he lives or a few feet away. It is always on his doorstep.
author: Paul Strand

quote: I think of real estate as a little bit like cooking or like art.
author: Jerry Speyer

quote: Our vision is to rediscover the spirit of the Renaissance, create a new discipline where engineering for cultural heritage is actually a symbol of blending art and science together.
author: Maurizio Seracini

quote: I started to make a study of the art of war and revolution and, whilst abroad, underwent a course in military training. If there was to be guerrilla warfare, I wanted to be able to stand and fight with my people and to share the hazards of war with them.
author: Nelson Mandela

quote: Without art, the crudeness of reality would make the world unbearable.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: The concept of commercialism in the fashion and art world is looked down upon. You know, just to think, 'What amount of creativity does it take to make something that masses of people like?' And, 'How does creativity apply across the board?'
author: Kanye West

quote: The mediator of the inexpressible is the work of art.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: Love isn't an emotion or an instinct - it's an art.
author: Mae West

quote: There is no more difficult art to acquire than the art of observation, and for some men it is quite as difficult to record an observation in brief and plain language.
author: William Osler

quote: A race is a work of art that people can look at and be affected in as many ways they're capable of understanding.
author: Steve Prefontaine

quote: I don't believe in art. I believe in artists.
author: Marcel Duchamp

quote: The art of Peace I practice has room for each of the world's eight million gods, and I cooperate with them all. The God of Peace is very great and enjoins all that is divine and enlightened in every land.
author: Morihei Ueshiba

quote: To want friendship is a great fault. Friendship ought to be a gratuitous joy, like the joys afforded by art or life.
author: Simone Weil

quote: Thou art my single day, God lends to leaven What were all earth else, with a feel of heaven.
author: Robert Browning

quote: Experience was my only teacher; I knew little of the modern art movement. When I first saw the works of the Impressionists, van Gogh, van Dongen, and Fauves, I admired it. But I had to seek the true way alone.
author: Piet Mondrian

quote: My painting does not come from the easel.
author: Jackson Pollock

quote: When I went to school, you had to take art, you had to play an instrument. You had to play an instrument. But it's all degraded since then. I do not know what kind of nation we are that is cutting art, music, and gym out of the public-school curriculum.
author: Spike Lee

quote: Writing stopped being fun when I discovered the difference between good writing and bad and, even more terrifying, the difference between it and true art. And after that, the whip came down.
author: Truman Capote

quote: All art is autobiographical. The pearl is the oyster's autobiography.
author: Federico Fellini

quote: When you master the art of being fully awake to this moment, you bestow a precious gift on your soul - the experience of love. Being present is the art of the soul.
author: Debbie Ford

quote: One of the things I like about music is it's an abstract art, totally abstract, where you can convey an emotion, which I find amazing.
author: Bernard Sumner

quote: I've always enjoyed feeling a connection to the avant-garde, such as Dada and surrealism and pop art. The only thing the artist can do is be honest with themselves and make the art they want to make. That's what I've always done.
author: Jeff Koons

quote: We must not confuse distortion with innovation; distortion is useless change, art is beneficial change.
author: Chuck Jones

quote: To curb the machine and limit art to handicraft is a denial of opportunity.
author: Lewis Mumford

quote: To write is a relief from life's problems. It is a way in which you revenge yourself. In art, the writer achieves utopia. But any attempt to achieve social utopia is bound to catastrophe. If you want a society of saints, the result is hell, repression, totalitarianism, and persecution.
author: Mario Vargas Llosa

quote: I think of horror films as art, as films of confrontation. Films that make you confront aspects of your own life that are difficult to face. Just because you're making a horror film doesn't mean you can't make an artful film.
author: David Cronenberg

quote: In art or architecture your project is only done when you say it's done. If you want to rip it apart at the eleventh hour and start all over again, you never finish. I was one of those crazy creatures.
author: Maya Lin

quote: I always like to leave art and music open to interpretation.
author: Dan Reynolds

quote: Art in Nature is rhythmic and has a horror of constraint.
author: Robert Delaunay

quote: I received from my experience in Japan an incredible sense of respect for the art of creating, not just the creative product. We're all about the product. To me, the process was also an incredibly important aspect of the total form.
author: Julie Taymor

quote: Whatever may be thought of my art, it is my own; and I would rather possess a freehold, though but a cottage, than live in a palace belonging to another.
author: John Constable

quote: To help, to continually help and share, that is the sum of all knowledge; that is the meaning of art.
author: Eleonora Duse

quote: What a beautiful art, but what a wretched profession.
author: Georges Bizet

quote: Art is not an end in itself, but a means of addressing humanity.
author: Modest Mussorgsky

quote: I do not know what the spirit of a philosopher could more wish to be than a good dancer. For the dance is his ideal, also his fine art, finally also the only kind of piety he knows, his 'divine service.'
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: If you do not breathe through writing, if you do not cry out in writing, or sing in writing, then don't write, because our culture has no use for it.
author: Anais Nin

quote: For his heart was in his work, and the heart giveth grace unto every art.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: If your choice enters into it, then taste is involved - bad taste, good taste, uninteresting taste. Taste is the enemy of art, A-R-T.
author: Marcel Duchamp

quote: Great Art is Great because it inspired you greatly. If it didn't, no matter what the critics, the museums and the galleries say, it's not great art for you.
author: Yoko Ono

quote: I don't want to be interesting. I want to be good.
author: Ludwig Mies van der Rohe

quote: If you cannot learn to love real art, at least learn to hate sham art and reject it.
author: William Morris

quote: Art is a process of delivering or arranging elements that appeal to the emotions of a person looking at it. It's what you feel.
author: Shaquille O'Neal

quote: You don't always have to show art in what's called a white box; you can have a kind of complexity within an exhibit which actually respects the art as well.
author: Zaha Hadid

quote: Life is very nice, but it lacks form. It's the aim of art to give it some.
author: Jean Anouilh

quote: All great art is born of the metropolis.
author: Ezra Pound

quote: In the 1960s when the recording studio suddenly really took off as a tool, it was the kids from art school who knew how to use it, not the kids from music school. Music students were all stuck in the notion of music as performance, ephemeral. Whereas for art students, music as painting? They knew how to do that.
author: Brian Eno

quote: Obviously, Kanye and I are very different in the way we express ourselves publicly. He's so passionate... about art, about culture, about creativity. And he's really good at it. And that honesty manifests itself in ways that are not politically correct, not socially acceptable sometimes.
author: John Legend

quote: When I judge art, I take my painting and put it next to a God made object like a tree or flower. If it clashes, it is not art.
author: Paul Cezanne

quote: An artist's only concern is to shoot for some kind of perfection, and on his own terms, not anyone else's.
author: J. D. Salinger

quote: I'm really into the recycling of art. That one piece of art inspires another piece of art, which inspires another piece of art. I really like that idea.
author: Mark Foster

quote: Some people have been kind enough to call me a fine artist. I've always called myself an illustrator. I'm not sure what the difference is. All I know is that whatever type of work I do, I try to give it my very best. Art has been my life.
author: Norman Rockwell

quote: When you use the language of 'fact checking' to talk about a film, I think you're sort of fundamentally misunderstanding how art works. You don't fact check Monet's 'Water Lilies.' That's not what water lilies look like; that's what the sensation of experiencing water lilies feel like. That's the goal of the piece.
author: Graham Moore

quote: Art is for everybody.
author: Keith Haring

quote: The artist one day falls through a hole in the brambles, and from that moment he is following the dark rapids of an underground river which may sometimes flow so near to the surface that the laughing picnic parties are heard above.
author: Cyril Connolly

quote: Even a true artist does not always produce art.
author: Carroll O'Connor

quote: All good art, to me, is uncertainty.
author: Dave Davies

quote: Layer by layer art strips life bare.
author: Robert Musil

quote: Through art and science in their broadest senses it is possible to make a permanent contribution towards the improvement and enrichment of human life and it is these pursuits that we students are engaged in.
author: Frederick Sanger

quote: You should trust any man in his own art provided he is skilled in it.
author: Edward Coke

quote: The construction of Europe is an art. It is the art of the possible.
author: Jacques Chirac

quote: Art is exalted above religion and race. Not a single solitary soul these days believes in the religions of the Assyrians, the Egyptians and the Greeks... Only their art, whenever it was beautiful, stands proud and exalted, rising above all time.
author: Emil Nolde

quote: Every picture shows a spot with which the artist has fallen in love.
author: Alfred Sisley

quote: An artist never works under ideal conditions. If they existed, his work wouldn't exist, for the artist doesn't live in a vacuum. Some sort of pressure must exist. The artist exists because the world is not perfect. Art would be useless if the world were perfect, as man wouldn't look for harmony but would simply live in it.
author: Andrei Tarkovsky

quote: She was an enthusiastic painter of oils and watercolors. She was also very generous. I could mess with her paints and brushes all I wanted. On one condition: that I kept my brushes clean. The only art lesson my mother gave me was how to wash my brushes.
author: Barbara Cooney

quote: Every art and every inquiry, and similarly every action and choice, is thought to aim at some good; and for this reason the good has rightly been declared to be that at which all things aim.
author: Aristotle

quote: Art is parasitic on life, just as criticism is parasitic on art.
author: Harry S Truman

quote: The web, then, or the pattern, a web at once sensuous and logical, an elegant and pregnant texture: that is style, that is the foundation of the art of literature.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quote: Art begins with resistance - at the point where resistance is overcome. No human masterpiece has ever been created without great labor.
author: Andre Gide

quote: The terrifying and edible beauty of Art Nouveau architecture.
author: Salvador Dali

quote: It's clever, but is it Art?
author: Rudyard Kipling

quote: All good art is an indiscretion.
author: Tennessee Williams

quote: There are worlds of experience beyond the world of the aggressive man, beyond history, and beyond science. The moods and qualities of nature and the revelations of great art are equally difficult to define; we can grasp them only in the depths of our perceptive spirit.
author: Ansel Adams

quote: All art is dependent on technology because it's a human endeavour, so even when you're using charcoal on a wall or designed the proscenium arch, that's technology.
author: George Lucas

quote: I had always planned to make a large painting of the early spring, when the first leaves are at the bottom of the trees, and they seem to float in space in a wonderful way. But the arrival of spring can't be done in one picture.
author: David Hockney

quote: It has become progressively clearer that the plastic expression of true reality is attained through dynamic movement in equilibrium. Plastic art affirms that equilibrium can only be established through the balance of unequal but equivalent oppositions.
author: Piet Mondrian

quote: Emotion resulting from a work of art is only of value when it is not obtained by sentimental blackmail.
author: Jean Cocteau

quote: Art is the right hand of Nature. The latter has only given us being, the former has made us men.
author: Friedrich Schiller

quote: When lovely woman stoops to folly, and finds too late that men betray, what charm can soothe her melancholy, what art can wash her guilt away?
author: Oliver Goldsmith

quote: It is not in life, but in art that self-fulfillment is to be found.
author: Wilson Mizner

quote: For me, art is about learning and about living with people. It's alive.
author: Miuccia Prada

quote: 'Untitled' is a time machine that can transport you to 1992, an edgy moment when the art world was crumbling, money was scarce, and artists like Tiravanija were in the nascent stages of combining Happenings, performance art, John Cage, Joseph Beuys, and the do-it-yourself ethos of punk. Meanwhile, a new art world was coming into being.
author: Jerry Saltz

quote: The history of modern art is also the history of the progressive loss of art's audience. Art has increasingly become the concern of the artist and the bafflement of the public.
author: Paul Gauguin

quote: I am not strong on perfection.
author: Jasper Johns

quote: Your talent is your art. It is not to be taken for granted.
author: Paula Abdul

quote: Art is very tricky because it's what you do for yourself. It's much harder for me to make those works than the monuments or the architecture.
author: Maya Lin

quote: Beauty in art is often nothing but ugliness subdued.
author: Jean Rostand

quote: A great artist is always before his time or behind it.
author: George Edward Moore

quote: Hip-hop is such a disposable art form from a business standpoint. It never treats its artists as art; it never treats its product as art.
author: Questlove

quote: To me, photography is the simultaneous recognition, in a fraction of a second, of the significance of an event.
author: Henri Cartier-Bresson

quote: Objectifying is kind of a funny thing. Art is objectification, all art, because you're taking someone and making them into an object. But people can also talk back more to you when you're sketching them. They can look at you and say, 'Oh man, you got me wrong.'
author: Molly Crabapple

quote: I didn't have any real art training, but when I was about twelve nad thirteen, another boy and I went to a sign painter's house every Friday night and took lessons.
author: Rube Goldberg

quote: Absence is one of the most useful ingredients of family life, and to dose it rightly is an art like any other.
author: Freya Stark

quote: We live in an age when the traditional great subjects - the human form, the landscape, even newer traditions such as abstract expressionism - are daily devalued by commercial art.
author: Andy Warhol

quote: To say that a work of art is good, but incomprehensible to the majority of men, is the same as saying of some kind of food that it is very good but that most people can't eat it.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: I think you can leave the arts, superior or inferior, to the conscience of mankind.
author: William Butler Yeats

quote: It is a symbol of Irish art. The cracked looking-glass of a servant.
author: James Joyce

quote: Of all lies, art is the least untrue.
author: Gustave Flaubert

quote: What art offers is space - a certain breathing room for the spirit.
author: John Updike

quote: Art is magic delivered from the lie of being truth.
author: Theodor Adorno

quote: The waking mind is the least serviceable in the arts.
author: Henry Miller

quote: The basis of art is truth, both in matter and in mode.
author: Flannery O'Connor

quote: Art is always an exaggeration in some sense; in color, in form, even in theme, etc... but it has always been this way. It is the same with the nature of some works by Giotto or Massacio, or the color of life as expressed by Van Gogh.
author: Fernando Botero

quote: Art is like a border of flowers along the course of civilization.
author: Lincoln Steffens

quote: My hand is the extension of the thinking process - the creative process.
author: Tadao Ando

quote: I don't think there is such a thing as being too raunchy when it comes to the art form of burlesque.
author: Christina Aguilera

quote: The message of great art is to disturb.
author: Elayne Boosler

quote: Art depends on luck and talent.
author: Francis Ford Coppola

quote: The worse my drawings were, the more beautiful did the originals appear.
author: John James Audubon

quote: It is a mistake for a sculptor or a painter to speak or write very often about his job. It releases tension needed for his work.
author: Henry Moore

quote: Mournful and yet grand is the destiny of the artist.
author: Franz Liszt

quote: When I work, and in my art, I hold hands with God.
author: Robert Mapplethorpe

quote: An empty canvas is full.
author: Robert Rauschenberg

quote: Great artists suffer for the people.
author: Marvin Gaye

quote: The final purpose of art is to intensify, even, if necessary, to exacerbate, the moral consciousness of people.
author: Norman Mailer

quote: Works of art make rules; rules do not make works of art.
author: Claude Debussy

quote: Painting seems like some kind of peculiar miracle that I need to have again and again.
author: Philip Guston

quote: To paint is a possessing rather than a picturing.
author: Philip Guston

quote: Trying to force creativity is never good.
author: Sarah McLachlan

quote: I don't have this obsessive need to do street art all the time because it's already opened doors for me.
author: Shepard Fairey

quote: Art is too serious to be taken seriously.
author: Ad Reinhardt

quote: No art that is not in the end understood by the People can live or ever did live a single generation.
author: Frank Norris

quote: I love art, being so close to the galleries, being by the water - and sunsets from the terrace.
author: Edgardo Osorio

quote: An artist is forced by others to paint out of his own free will.
author: Willem de Kooning

quote: Life is an illusion. I am held together in the nothingness by art.
author: Anselm Kiefer

quote: Most art is fragile and some should be placed and never moved away.
author: Donald Judd

quote: As an architect, you have to provide a shelter to enjoy art. And you have to love art. It's like when you make a concert hall. You must love music. This is the reason why you make the space, to enjoy music - making a space for art is the same thing.
author: Renzo Piano

quote: Painting is by nature a luminous language.
author: Robert Delaunay

quote: A painting that is well composed is half finished.
author: Pierre Bonnard

quote: A room hung with pictures is a room hung with thoughts.
author: Joshua Reynolds

quote: Art is about going a little nuts... Kids do art for fun. It's playing.
author: William McDonough

quote: The philistine provides the best definition of art. Anything that makes him rage is first class.
author: Louis Dudek

quote: It is more important to click with people than to click the shutter.
author: Alfred Eisenstaedt

quote: We are only beginning to learn what to say in a photograph. The world we live in is a succession of fleeting moments, any one of which might say something significant.
author: Alfred Eisenstaedt

quote: I want to try and be as involved in the art of filmmaking as possible. I feel that the only way to really do that is to take on as many roles as possible, whether it be as an actor, an editor, a director, a cinematographer.
author: Joe Swanberg

quote: Art owes its origin to Nature herself... this beautiful creation, the world, supplied the first model, while the original teacher was that divine intelligence which has not only made us superior to the other animals, but like God Himself, if I may venture to say it.
author: Giorgio Vasari

quote: Part of what I do and what I want to do is I want to bring art into the everyday life. If you can take ordinary just walking in the street and you're confronted by something, that might change your day - it might inspire you.
author: Kenny Scharf

quote: I personally don't care for abstract art. I have always felt, 'To each his own.' There's art out there for everybody.
author: Howard Terpning

quote: Art for art's sake is a philosophy of the well-fed.
author: Frank Lloyd Wright

quote: In the Raphael Room, the secret turned out to be that only some of the paintings were made by the great master; the rest were made by students. I had liked the ones by Raphael. This was a big jab for my self-confidence in my ability to appreciate art.
author: Richard P. Feynman

quote: If we could but paint with the hand what we see with the eye.
author: Honore de Balzac

quote: Art works because it appeals to certain faculties of the mind. Music depends on details of the auditory system, painting and sculpture on the visual system. Poetry and literature depend on language.
author: Steven Pinker

quote: A work of art has no importance whatever to society. It is only important to the individual.
author: Vladimir Nabokov

quote: Every time a student walks past a really urgent, expressive piece of architecture that belongs to his college, it can help reassure him that he does have that mind, does have that soul.
author: Louis Kahn

quote: Art is an invention of aesthetics, which in turn is an invention of philosophers... What we call art is a game.
author: Octavio Paz

quote: Art is the final cunning of the human soul which would rather do anything than face the gods.
author: Iris Murdoch

quote: I am not brave enough to not pay my income tax and risk going to jail. But I can say rather freely what I want to say with my art.
author: Corita Kent

quote: There hasn't been any art yet. Art is just beginning.
author: Constantin Brancusi

quote: Death is an endless night so awful to contemplate that it can make us love life and value it with such passion that it may be the ultimate cause of all joy and all art.
author: Paul Theroux

quote: Politics separate men by bringing them together only superficially. Art and culture unite us in a common anguish that is our only possible fraternity, that of our existential and metaphysical community.
author: Eugene Ionesco

quote: To make pictures big is to make them more powerful.
author: Robert Mapplethorpe

quote: You begin with the possibilities of the material.
author: Robert Rauschenberg

quote: Every artist writes his own autobiography.
author: Havelock Ellis

quote: When one paints an ideal, one does not need to limit one's imagination.
author: Ellen Key

quote: Every creator painfully experiences the chasm between his inner vision and its ultimate expression.
author: Isaac Bashevis Singer

quote: Artists don't make objects. Artists make mythologies.
author: Anish Kapoor

quote: The perfection of art is to conceal art.
author: Quintilian

quote: Paint the essential character of things.
author: Camille Pissarro

quote: Vitality is radiated from exceptional art and architecture.
author: Arthur Erickson

quote: Art is everywhere, and everywhere is art.
author: Brandon Boyd

quote: I will preach with my brush.
author: Henry Ossawa Tanner

quote: Immature artists imitate. Mature artists steal.
author: Lionel Trilling

quote: Art is a revolt against fate. All art is a revolt against man's fate.
author: Andre Malraux

quote: I don't want to sound pretentious, but I love art, I like to go to museums, and I like to read books.
author: Rainn Wilson

quote: Art matters.
author: Barbara Januszkiewicz

quote: The best artists know what to leave out.
author: Charles de Lint

quote: A great artist can paint a great picture on a small canvas.
author: Charles Dudley Warner

quote: Wherever art appears, life disappears.
author: Robert Motherwell

quote: When artists make art, they shouldn't question whether it is permissible to do one thing or another.
author: Sol LeWitt

quote: The mission of art is to represent nature not to imitate her.
author: William Morris Hunt

quote: Draw your pleasure, paint your pleasure, and express your pleasure strongly.
author: Pierre Bonnard

quote: Artists live in unknown spaces and give themselves over to following something unknown.
author: Kiki Smith

quote: One must always draw, draw with the eyes, when one cannot draw with a pencil.
author: Balthus

quote: Contrary to general belief, an artist is never ahead of his time but most people are far behind theirs.
author: Edgard Varese

quote: I don't want life to imitate art. I want life to be art.
author: Ernst Fischer

quote: What I wish to show when I paint is the way I see things with my eyes and in my heart.
author: Raoul Dufy

quote: The art of an artist must be his own art. It is... always a continuous chain of little inventions, little technical discoveries of one's own, in one's relation to the tool, the material and the colors.
author: Emil Nolde

quote: The arts are an even better barometer of what is happening in our world than the stock market or the debates in congress.
author: Hendrik Willem Van Loon

quote: Painting, n.: The art of protecting flat surfaces from the weather, and exposing them to the critic.
author: Ambrose Bierce

quote: To make us feel small in the right way is a function of art; men can only make us feel small in the wrong way.
author: E. M. Forster

quote: I don't understand it. Jack will spend any amount of money to buy votes but he balks at investing a thousand dollars in a beautiful painting.
author: Jackie Kennedy

quote: What I didn't know was I was deeply attracted to the big space.
author: David Hockney

quote: I do not want art for a few any more than education for a few, or freedom for a few.
author: William Morris

quote: Time extracts various values from a painter's work. When these values are exhausted the pictures are forgotten, and the more a picture has to give, the greater it is.
author: Henri Matisse

quote: The history of art is the history of revivals.
author: Samuel Butler

quote: I don't think there's any artist of any value who doesn't doubt what they're doing.
author: Francis Ford Coppola

quote: That's the motivation of an artist - to seek attention of some kind.
author: James Taylor

quote: Painting and writing are solitary arts.
author: Conrad Hall

quote: Art is nature speeded up and God slowed down.
author: Malcolm de Chazal

quote: That's why people listen to music or look at paintings. To get in touch with that wholeness.
author: Corita Kent

quote: I think an artist's responsibility is more complex than people realize.
author: Jodie Foster

quote: The role of a museum of modern art is to make a good selection and identify what we believe to be the coming movements, and that requires taste.
author: David Rockefeller

quote: The Japanese have a wonderful sense of design and a refinement in their art. They try to produce beautiful paintings with the minimum number of strokes.
author: David Rockefeller

quote: The more horrifying this world becomes, the more art becomes abstract.
author: Ellen Key

quote: Art distills sensations and embodies it with enhanced meaning.
author: Miguel de Unamuno

quote: The vitality of a new movement in Art must be gauged by the fury it arouses.
author: Logan Pearsall Smith

quote: Rationalism is the enemy of art, though necessary as a basis for architecture.
author: Arthur Erickson

quote: Art is the child of Nature; yes, her darling child, in whom we trace the features of the mother's face, her aspect and her attitude.
author: Beck

quote: The writer, when he is also an artist, is someone who admits what others don't dare reveal.
author: Elia Kazan

quote: I see myself and many artists like me as the torchbearers through these dark ages.
author: John Zorn

quote: No heirloom of humankind captures the past as do art and language.
author: Theodore Bikel

quote: Art ought never to be considered except in its relations with its ideal beauty.
author: Alfred de Vigny

quote: Of what use were the arts if they were only the reproduction and the imitation of life?
author: Alfred de Vigny

quote: What marks the artist is his power to shape the material of pain we all have.
author: Lionel Trilling

quote: Art is one thing that can go on mattering once it has stopped hurting.
author: Elizabeth Bowen

quote: I'm not gonna give the British Government the joy of keeping taxing me. They don't tax art. And all my cars are just a collection of art.
author: Jay Kay

quote: I realize that protest paintings are not exactly in vogue, but I've done many.
author: Robert Indiana

quote: I think of my peace paintings as one long poem, with each painting being a single stanza.
author: Robert Indiana

quote: I was the least Pop of all the Pop artists.
author: Robert Indiana

quote: I've never really had a hobby, unless you count art, which the IRS once told me I had to declare as a hobby since I hadn't made money with it.
author: Laurie Anderson

quote: Art must take reality by surprise.
author: Francoise Sagan

quote: Modern art is what happens when painters stop looking at girls and persuade themselves that they have a better idea.
author: John Ciardi

quote: Insight is the first condition of Art.
author: George Henry Lewes

quote: Artists themselves are not confined, but their output is.
author: Robert Smithson

quote: An artist carries on throughout his life a mysterious, uninterrupted conversation with his public.
author: Maurice Chevalier

quote: I hope to live all my life for my art, without abandoning my principles one iota.
author: Gustave Courbet

quote: Painting is a nail to which I fasten my ideas.
author: Georges Braque

quote: Great art is never produced for its own sake. It is too difficult to be worth the effort.
author: Robert Quillen

quote: When I make art, I think about its ability to connect with others, to bring them into the process.
author: Jim Hodges

quote: Photography is a major force in explaining man to man.
author: Edward Steichen

quote: In art, the obvious is a sin.
author: Edward Dmytryk

quote: Great art is an instant arrested in eternity.
author: James Huneker
